text: so I had my I had my HBS interview on a
satellite phone from Fallujah Iraq and
the the interviewer asked me at the end
of the interview if I had any questions
for him I said well yeah what's what's
HBS like I've never been there he said
well it's a transformational place so
not transformational and and you didn't
really expand on that and I was a little
bit skeptical of what he meant by
transformational because we've been
through a few attempted transformations
in the military and we're still working
on a few as well anyways I came back
from from Moroccan and spring and came
to a my first my first week here to to
sort of do an orientation and when I
came into the class the first class that
Professor induced me and said that this
is a veteran that's visiting us today
and the entire class stood up and
applauded and that was that hit me in a
pretty profound way because it wasn't it
wasn't what I was expecting
coming to Harvard and but it was it was
just a taste of things that come because
I think that one of the things that
makes the school a really special places
is the diversity of experiences and the
respect that people have for for those
experiences coming into it
